page.title: 07HURLFORD/CROOKEDHOLM CHURCH.
page.content: There are three churches in the area. Two are Church of Scotland and one is Roman Catholic. Two of the churches are situated in Crookedholm and the Roman Catholic Church, St. Pauls, in Hurlford. A fourth large church in Hurlford is no longer used for that purpose. Hurlford Kirk with a congregation of 678 is in the charge of the Rev.J.Brodie. and Reid Memorial Church with a congregation of 590 is in the charge of a lady minister, the Rev.E.Houston. All three churches were built in the second half of the 19th. Century. Crookedholm was the centre of religious life during the 18th.C., people travelling from as far as Ayr and Saltcoats for Sunday worship. There is a story of a young mother who carried her baby from Beith to Crookedholm for baptism in 1777 and returned home the same day.
